name: Hostelling International Portland Hawthorne Hostel

reviews.text: Great hostel. Very homey and safe. Loved the location. Easy to get to by bus from downtown. Cute district - cruise down the street for great shops, pubs and coffee. Portland is so friendly and this hostel is great!
reviews.title: Loved this hostel!

likes.liked: — Down to Earth staff. Eco-friendly and safe. house cat.
likes.disliked: — Wish I didn't have to walk through the kitchen to the bathroom downstairs.

reviews.text: Nice hostel in a big house with friendly staff. Big seats next to the bunks, big segregated bathrooms and nice big kitchen. I do a lot of sightseeing so I'm not one to hang out too much, but there is a very friendly crowd going thru the hostel, but never rowdy. The lockers were located in the back but very few poeple were using them, the hostel has such a welcoming, homesy feeling. You're only one bus or a 45 minute walk away from downtown but a mile north of the hostel is a rail stop that'll take you anywhere. Powell's Hawthorne branch is just a few blocks away and worth a visit. All in all, a near perfect hostel.
reviews.title: One of the better Hostels

reviews.text: As far as hostels go, this one is above average for price and location. Definitely felt safe there, well I felt that way in all of Portland actually. The people were very nice hippie nouveau types, and the place is conveniently located right on the bus line into the city. Good Bohemian fun. The hostel is in the Hawthorne district, which is full of eclectic shops, and it's also close to the Belmont district. Good restaurants there. All walkable. Three places you have to go in Portland: the Japanese Gardens, Powell's City of Books, and the Saturday Market.
reviews.title: Above Average
Great hostel and travelers' community.
reviews.text: Eco-roof, great porch, cool people, colorfully decorated - what more could you ask for from a hostel in Portland? The dorm beds are fine, but the common areas - stocked kitchen, dining/hang-out table, porches - are what make this hostel social and therefore good. Also, you get free bagels & bread, and occasionally pizza. There's a campground out back ("camp city"), which I thought was pretty hip too. Definitely to be recommended!

Stayed for one night on a road trip through Washington and Oregon. this hostel is in a great location, in the funky Hawthorne neighborhood with great restaraunts and shops. Had fun and met lots of cool travellers from all over the world! The common area is full of books and resources for travel in the area.
reviews.title: Great hostel!

reviews.text: If you simply need to sleep, not shower or use the bathroom, this hostel is fine. BUT, it is incredibly dirty. There was pizza in the bathroom, the water didnt drain out of the shower and they were talking about the mice problem while I was there. I stayed 2 nights but left early-- and believe me, I am far from a neat freak.
reviews.title: Dirty

reviews.text: This was the very first hostel WITHIN the U.S. that I stayed at on recommendation of a friend and it did not disappoint at all. The hostel itself is situated within a larger, older style home. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the onsite dog was a good companion reminding me of my own two dogs waiting for me at home.
reviews.title: Quality gem

likes.liked: — great staff and location, loved the recycling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in an all-female multi-bedded room (I believe there were 8 beds total in it), which was a generous sized room with enough ample space for all the guests occupying it. The shared bathrooms were clean and made you feel like you were staying at Auntie Nelly's house. They were very charming and something you would expect from staying at a relative's home.
reviews.title: Cozy and Homey!

likes.liked: — So cozy and welcoming, like home sweet home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kitchen was also very tidy with everyone being respectful to clean up each's dirty dishes and whatnot. The best part was the recycling aspect, which was a nice surprise to see a hostel being such a forerunner in that aspect.
reviews.title: Dirty, grubby, ants

aka: Hostelling International Portland Hawthorne Hotel Portland
description: HI-Portland Hawthorne Hostel is a non-profit travelers lodge that offers an affordable, clean and fun place to stay. It has recognized been around the world as being a sustainable and green business. Also known as "Your Eco-Home Away From Home". Our mission is "To Help All Especially the Young Gain a Greater Understanding of the World and it's People Through Hostelling". Free wi-fi and internet access, free long distance phone use, free parking, free kitchen use, free coffee/tea, free all-u-can make pancake breakfast and bagels/bread and cream cheese(when available), free towel and lock rentals (with deposit).We have men's, women's, and coed dorm room as well as 2 private rooms. Reservations are recommended. Must have out-of-town i.d. to stay to here.
